data.title: Introduction to n8n
data.description:
A beginner's guide to understanding and implementing workflow automation using the n8n tool. This course aims to equip non-technical professionals, business analysts, and junior developers with the skills to automate tasks and integrate applications without the need for advanced coding.

Making a change for the halfwit claude model.
data.imageAttribution: Photo by Anoir Chafik on Unsplash

modules.title: Understanding Workflow Automation and n8n
modules.description: Introduction to the basics of workflow automation and the role of n8n in the automation ecosystem.

lessons.title: The Basics of Workflow Automation
lessons.content: An overview of workflow automation and its benefits.

lessons.title: Introduction to n8n
lessons.content: An introduction to n8n, its purpose, and its place in the automation ecosystem.

modules.title: Navigating the n8n Interface
modules.description: A guide to navigating n8n's interface, including the workflow editor, node library, and execution logs.

lessons.title: Exploring the n8n Interface
lessons.content: A tour of the n8n interface, focusing on the workflow editor and node library.

lessons.title: Working with Execution Logs
lessons.content: A guide to using execution logs to monitor and debug workflows.

modules.title: Building and Running Workflows
modules.description: Learn to build and run simple workflows using common nodes like email, webhook, and Google Sheets.

lessons.title: Building Simple Workflows
lessons.content: Creating simple workflows using common nodes.

lessons.title: Configuring Triggers and Actions
lessons.content: A guide to configuring triggers and actions to automate processes.

modules.title: Monitoring and Refining Workflows
modules.description: Learn to monitor, debug and refine workflows using n8n's execution logs and error handling features.

lessons.title: Monitoring Workflows
lessons.content: Using n8n's execution logs to monitor workflows.

lessons.title: Debugging and Refining Workflows
lessons.content: A guide to debugging and improving workflows using error handling features.

imageData.imageAttribution: Photo by Anoir Chafik on Unsplash

modules.title: Understanding Workflow Automation and n8n
modules.description: Introduction to the basics of workflow automation and the role of n8n in the automation ecosystem.

lessons.title: The Basics of Workflow Automation
lessons.content:
An overview of workflow automation and its benefits.

// Example: Simple greeting function
function greetUser(name) {
  if (!name) {
    return "Hello, Guest!";
  }
  return `Hello, ${name}!`;
}

// Usage
console.log(greetUser("Mick")); // Output: Hello, Mick!

modules.title: Understanding Workflow Automation and n8n
modules.description: Introduction to the basics of workflow automation and the role of n8n in the automation ecosystem.

lessons.title: The Basics of Workflow Automation
lessons.content:
An overview of workflow automation and its benefits.

// Example: Simple greeting function
function greetUser(name) {
  if (!name) {
    return "Hello, Guest!";
  }
  return `Hello, ${name}!`;

lessons.title: Introduction to n8n

modules.title: Navigating the n8n Interface
modules.description: A guide to navigating n8n's interface, including the workflow editor, node library, and execution logs.

lessons.title: Exploring the n8n Interface
lessons.content: A tour of the n8n interface, focusing on the workflow editor and node library.

lessons.title: Working with Execution Logs
lessons.content:
A guide to using execution logs to monitor and debug workflows.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>JavaScript Sample</title>
</head>
<body>
  <h1>Hello, JavaScript!</h1>
  <button id="myButton">Click Me</button>

  <script>
    // Get the button element by its ID
    const button = document.getElementById("myButton");

    // Add a click event listener
    button.addEventListener("click", () => {
      alert("Button was clicked!");
    });
  </script>
</body>
</html>

data.description:
A beginner's guide to understanding and implementing workflow automation using the n8n tool. This course aims to equip non-technical professionals, business analysts, and junior developers with the skills to automate tasks and integrate applications without the need for advanced coding.

Making a change for the halfwit claude model.
data.imageAttribution: Photo by Erik-Jan Leusink on Unsplash

modules.title: Understanding Workflow Automation and n8n
modules.description: Introduction to the basics of workflow automation and the role of n8n in the automation ecosystem.

lessons.title: The Basics of Workflow Automation
lessons.content:
An overview of workflow automation and its benefits.

// Example: Simple greeting function
function greetUser(name) {
  if (!name) {
    return "Hello, Guest!";
  }
  return `Hello, ${name}!`;
}

// Usage
console.log(greetUser("Mick")); // Output: Hello, Mick!

lessons.title: Introduction to n8n
lessons.content: An introduction to n8n, its purpose, and its place in the automation ecosystem.

lessons.title: Video Lesson Example
lessons.content: This is a video lesson

modules.title: Navigating the n8n Interface
modules.description: A guide to navigating n8n's interface, including the workflow editor, node library, and execution logs.

lessons.title: Exploring the n8n Interface
lessons.content: A tour of the n8n interface, focusing on the workflow editor and node library.

lessons.title: Working with Execution Logs
lessons.content:
A guide to using execution logs to monitor and debug workflows.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>JavaScript Sample</title>
</head>
<body>
  <h1>Hello, JavaScript!</h1>
  <button id="myButton">Click Me</button>

  <script>
    // Get the button element by its ID
    const button = document.getElementById("myButton");

    // Add a click event listener
    button.addEventListener("click", () => {
      alert("Button was clicked!");
    });
  </script>
</body>
</html>

modules.title: Building and Running Workflows
modules.description: Learn to build and run simple workflows using common nodes like email, webhook, and Google Sheets.

lessons.title: Building Simple Workflows
lessons.content: Creating simple workflows using common nodes.

lessons.title: Configuring Triggers and Actions
lessons.content: A guide to configuring triggers and actions to automate processes.

lessons.title: Video as Example
lessons.content: <video-block data="%7B%22type%22%3A%22video%22%2C%22provider%22%3A%22youtube%22%2C%22url%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DXzNi70r8UJE%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Video%20as%20Example%22%7D"></video-block>

modules.title: Monitoring and Refining Workflows
modules.description: Learn to monitor, debug and refine workflows using n8n's execution logs and error handling features.

lessons.title: Monitoring Workflows
lessons.content: Using n8n's execution logs to monitor workflows.

lessons.title: Debugging and Refining Workflows
lessons.content: A guide to debugging and improving workflows using error handling features.

data.title: Mastering Cursor Good Practices for Enhanced Productivity
data.description: This intermediate-level course is designed to equip software developers, data scientists, and technical writers with the knowledge and skills to use Cursor effectively. The course covers configuring Cursor for different development environments, applying best practices for AI-assisted coding, and using Cursor’s navigation and code-understanding features to speed up debugging and reviews.
data.imageAttribution: Photo by ThisisEngineering RAEng on Unsplash

modules.title: Setting Up Cursor
modules.description: Understand how to setup and configure Cursor effectively for your development environment and workflow.

lessons.title: Installation and Setup

lessons.title: Navigating Code with Cursor
lessons.content: Learn how to navigate code effectively with Cursor.

lessons.title: Debugging and Code Review with Cursor
lessons.content: Use Cursor's code-understanding features to speed up debugging and code reviews.

imageData.imageAttribution: Photo by ThisisEngineering RAEng on Unsplash

data.title: Mastering Cursor Good Practices for Enhanced Productivity
data.description: This intermediate-level course is designed to equip software developers, data scientists, and technical writers with the knowledge and skills to use Cursor effectively. The course covers configuring Cursor for different development environments, applying best practices for AI-assisted coding, and using Cursor’s navigation and code-understanding features to speed up debugging and reviews.
data.imageAttribution: Photo by ThisisEngineering RAEng on Unsplash

modules.title: Setting Up Cursor
modules.description: Understand how to setup and configure Cursor effectively for your development environment and workflow.

lessons.title: Installation and Setup
lessons.content: Installation process and initial setup of Cursor.

lessons.title: Configuring Cursor for Productivity
lessons.content: How to configure Cursor to enhance your coding productivity.

modules.title: AI-Assisted Coding with Cursor
modules.description: Learn to leverage the power of AI to generate, refactor and explain code.

lessons.title: Generating Code with AI
lessons.content: Learn how to use Cursor's AI to generate code effectively.

lessons.title: Refactoring and Explaining Code with AI
lessons.content: Use AI to refactor and explain code, improving code quality and understanding.

data.title: Mastering Cursor for Beginners (Alligators Edition)
data.description: A comprehensive, beginner-friendly course designed to equip non-technical professionals, business analysts, and junior developers with the knowledge and skills to automate tasks and integrate apps using Cursor. The course covers essential settings, secrets management, test plan development, and best practices for initial code structure.
data.imageAttribution: Photo by Adam Kubín on Unsplash
